This academic endeavor has been an enriching experience, providing me with valuable insights into the world of robotics and automation.

Work


Aug '22 - Present

Graduate Research Volunteer (Logos Lab) | Arizona State University, Tempe, AZ —
Human-robot collaboration with mobile robots involves humans and robots working together to complete tasks efficiently and safely. These robots, designed to assist humans, handle repetitive or physically demanding work, while humans provide oversight and decision-making. This partnership enhances productivity and adaptability, making it a promising approach in robotics, where robots become valuable teammates, amplifying human capabilities and improving efficiency across industries.

May '23 - Aug '23

R&D UAV Intern | Hylio, Richmond, TX —
I played a pivotal role in software tool development, creating a robust solution to manage over 2,000 parameters for various drone models. This streamlined our engineering workflows and led to enhanced drone performance. Additionally, I tackled critical issues in the Ground Control Station, including custom command functionality, resulting in more efficient production processes and safer flights. I also conducted extensive testing to ensure the seamless management of multiple UAVs in large-scale operations. Furthermore, I contributed to drone firmware development, where I improved the path planning algorithm using the Dijkstra Path-Planner, achieving a remarkable 95% optimization rate and greatly enhancing drone navigation in complex terrains.

May '20 - Jun '20

UAV Intern | Magnum Wings,Guntur,India —
I enhanced UAV software for forest monitoring, crafting specific flight maneuvers and data collection routines. In close collaboration with engineers, I addressed and debugged issues related to the Pixhawk flight controller, configuring ArduPilot for optimal performance. This experience not only honed my technical skills but also fostered effective teamwork, communication, and problem-solving in the context of real-world UAV applications.
